column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1. Introduction
#Text=Due to rapid industrialization , air quality is recognized to be an issue of primary importance for human health .
#Text=Scientific studies have suggested links between air pollutants and numerous health problems .
#Text=Thereby , the neediness of improvement air quality in terms of pollutants concentration reduction is essential .
#Text=In order to deal with this issue , it is necessary to identify and implement long-term air pollution abatement strategies .

#Text=In this way , the European Union ( EU ) Framework supplies useful information on air quality assessment techniques , establishes limit values of the pollutants , and urges to develop Air Quality Plans , in particular through Directive 2008/50/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on ambient air quality and cleaner air for Europe ( amended by 2015/1480/EC ) .
#Text=In order to develop Air Quality Plans is essential to know properly the concentrations of the different several pollutants .

#Text=The EU normative ( Directive 2008/50/EC , amended by 2015/1480/EC ) suggests that 90 % of the data per year are necessary , and where possible , modelling techniques should be applied to enable point data to be interpreted in terms of geographical distribution of concentration .
#Text=This could serve as a basis for calculating the collective exposure of the population living in the area .
#Text=The results of modelling shall be taken into account for the assessment of air quality with respect to the target values .

#Text=In this context , a spatio-temporal modelling of PM10 ( particles < 10 m ) concentration is applied to understand the trend , to know the influence of the variables to exposure risk , to find the missing data to evaluate air quality , and to estimate data for those sites where they are not available .
#Text=In addition , it is a useful tool to reduce the number of the sampling points or the days of sampling when there is not enough equipment .
#Text=This assessment is essential to improve air quality policies and warning alert systems .
#Text=The lack of information in time series for each of the monitoring stations makes it difficult to analyse and manage statistics .
#Text=Previously , statistical methods have been used to predict the concentration of PM10 over time .
#Text=The aim of this study is to fill missing data by using interpolation statistical methods .
#Text=The study also focuses on testing the goodness of these methods in order to find the one that better approaches the gaps .
#Text=After comparing the results of the methods employed through the correlation analysis , the best matching method to restore missing data is chosen .
